response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Counting Substrings\", \"description\": \"Write a function `count_substrings` that takes two strings, `main_string` and `sub_string`, as input. The function should count the number of times `sub_string` appears in `main_string`. Consider only whole occurrences of `sub_string` within `main_string`, ignoring any remaining characters.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef count_substrings(main_string: str, sub_string: str) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `main_string` (str): The main string in which you want to search for the substring.\\n- `sub_string` (str): The substring you want to find in the main string.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the count of whole occurrences of the substring within the main string.\", \"code\": \"def count_substrings(main_string: str, sub_string: str) -> int:\\n    # Convert both strings to lowercase for case-insensitive matching\\n    main_string = main_string.lower()\\n    sub_string = sub_string.lower()\\n    # Count the number of occurrences using the index method and modulus\\n    count = 0\\n    i = 0\\n    while i <= len(main_string) - len(sub_string):\\n        if main_string[i:i+len(sub_string)] == sub_string:\\n            count += 1\\n            i += len(sub_string)\\n        else:\\n            i += 1\\n    return count\", \"tests\": [\"assert count_substrings('hello world hello', 'hello') == 2\", \"assert count_substrings('abcde', 'cd') == 1\", \"assert count_substrings('', 'abc') == 0\", \"assert count_substrings('a', 'a') == 1\"] }"
